metadata.key_specifications: Low forward voltage, low diode capacitance, leadless ultra small plastic package (1.0 mm x 0.6 mm x 0.48 mm), reverse voltage up to 15 V, forward current up to 30 mA, junction temperature up to 150°C
metadata.applications: UHF mixers, sampling circuits, modulators, phase detectors, mobile devices

page_summaries.content:
1. General description
An epitaxial Schottky barrier diode encapsulated in a SOD882 leadless ultra small plastic package.
ESD sensitive device, observe handling precautions.

2. Features and benefits
• Low forward voltage
• Low diode capacitance
• Leadless ultra small plastic package (1.0 mm x 0.6 mm x 0.48 mm)
• Boardspace 1.17 mm² (approx. 10 % of SOT23)
• Power dissipation comparable to SOT23

3. Applications
• UHF mixers
• Sampling circuits
• Modulators
• Phase detectors
• Mobile devices

4. Quick reference data

Product Summary.content: An epitaxial Schottky barrier diode encapsulated in a SOD882 leadless ultra small plastic package. ESD sensitive device, observe handling precautions. Low forward voltage, low diode capacitance, leadless ultra small plastic package (1.0 mm x 0.6 mm x 0.48 mm), boardspace 1.17 mm² (approx. 10 % of SOT23), power dissipation comparable to SOT23.
Applications: UHF mixers, sampling circuits, modulators, phase detectors, mobile devices. Quick reference data: reverse voltage up to 15 V, forward voltage up to 700 mV at 30 mA current.

Nexperia reserves the right to make changes to information published in this document, including without limitation specifications and product descriptions, at any time and without notice. This document supersedes and replaces all information supplied prior to the publication hereof.

Electrical Characteristics.content: Table 7 shows the electrical characteristics of the Schottky barrier diode, including forward voltage (VF), differential resistance (rdif), reverse current (IR), diode capacitance (Cd), and peak reverse recovery current (IRM). The conditions such as forward current (IF), reverse voltage (VR), pulse duration (tp), duty cycle (δ), frequency (f), and ambient temperature (Tamb) are specified for each parameter.

The forward voltage VF is specified for two different forward current conditions: IF = 1 mA with a maximum of 340 mV, and IF = 30 mA with a maximum of 700 mV, both at Tamb = 25 °C and with pulse duration tp ≤ 300 µs and duty cycle δ ≤ 0.02. The differential resistance rdif is typically 12 Ω at IF = 5 mA and f = 1 MHz.

The reverse current IR has a maximum of 0.2 µA at VR = 1 V, tp = 300 µs, δ = 0.02, and Tj = 25 °C. The diode capacitance Cd is typically 1 pF at VR = 0 V, f = 1 MHz, and Tamb = 25 °C. The peak reverse recovery current IRM is 12 A at IF = 5 mA, Tamb = 25 °C, and f = 1 MHz.

Fig. 3 shows the typical diode capacitance Cd as a function of reverse voltage VR at f = 1 MHz and Tamb = 25 °C. Fig. 4 shows the typical differential diode forward resistance rdif as a function of forward current IF at f = 1 MHz and Tamb = 25 °C.

Packaging Information.content: Nexperia 1PS10SB82 Schottky barrier diode. Package outline: DFN1006-2 (SOD882) with dimensions in mm: 0.55 x 0.47 x 0.65 (length x width x height), cathode marking on top side (if applicable), and a detailed package outline diagram.
Soldering information for the DFN1006-2 (SOD882) package, including a reflow soldering footprint diagram with dimensions in mm for solder lands, solder resist, occupied area, and solder paste.

The package outline and soldering information provide details on the physical dimensions, marking, and recommended soldering footprint for the Nexperia 1PS10SB82 Schottky barrier diode in the DFN1006-2 (SOD882) package.
